mil3.6.2:0.1_0: The Simile of the Making Hand
mil3.6.2:0.3_0: and all that is deep into gathering.
mil3.6.2:1.2_0: “Sabbakāmī, do you too know and see all?”
mil3.6.2:1.4_0: “Sir, why do you gradually describe a training rule?”
mil3.6.2:1.5_0: “But, great king, is there any other doctors who know all and see all the earth?”
mil3.6.2:1.7_0: “Great king, why is that doctor who brings medicine from the sick, or the need for medicine?”
mil3.6.2:1.8_0: “Sir, have the tonics been suspended for those who are sick; they’re not breastfeeding?”
mil3.6.2:1.9_0: “In the same way, great king, the Buddha hasn’t seen any training rules for his disciples and recite the monastic code.”
mil3.6.2:3.1_0: The second section on all sides is said.
